{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child presented with proptosis, which is the abnormal protrusion of the eye. The microscopic examination of the mass showed a round cell tumor that is positive for Desmin immunohistochemical marker. Based on these findings, the most likely diagnosis is embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Rhabdomyosarcoma is a malignant tumor that arises from skeletal muscle cells, and the positive staining for Desmin supports this diagnosis.", "answer_choice": "B. Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma"}
